snippet: The editor of Novaya Gazeta, a prominent newspaper, wrote an open letter accusing Russia’s chief federal investigator of threatening to kill a deputy editor.
abstract: Dmitry A Muratov, editor in chief of a prominent Moscow newspaper, charges that Aleksandr I Bastrykin, Russia’s chief federal investigator had threatened to kill the newspaper’s deputy editor over an article that documented corruption in the handling of a grisly murder case; very public accusation and the deputy editor’s decision to flee the country could have high-level political repercussions

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ellen Barry, Andrew Roth, Anna Kordunsky and Nikolay Khalip.

lead_paragraph: The editor of Novaya Gazeta, a prominent newspaper, wrote an open letter accusing Russia’s chief federal investigator of threatening to kill a deputy editor.

headline.seo: Novaya Gazeta Publicizes Russian Official’s Threat to Editor
headline.main: Russian Official’s Death Threat, in Bold Type
headline.print_headline: Russian Official’s Death Threat, in Bold Type
